intro: Phaseolus oblongus var. albus, commonly known as the white kidney bean, is a legume native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its smooth, white to pale yellow pods and kidney-shaped seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being ovate and hairy. This variety is cultivated for its edible seeds, which are rich in protein and fiber.
